sen.j: 朽木村（くつきむら）は、滋賀県西部の高島郡に存在した村。
sen.e: Kutsuki-mura was a village located in the former Takashima-gun in the west of Shiga Prefecture.
Kutsuki-mura was a village located in the former Takashima-gun in the west of Shiga Prefecture.
Kutsuki-mura was a village located in the former Takashima-gun in the west of Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 永らく滋賀県唯一の「村」だったが、2005年1月1日、同郡高島町 (滋賀県)、安曇川町、新旭町、今津町、マキノ町と合併して高島市となり、郡と共に廃止した。
sen.e: Kutsuki-mura had been the only village in Shiga Prefecture for a long time, but on January 1, 2005, Kutsuki-mura was merged with Takashima-cho in Takashima-gun, Adogawa-cho, Shinasahi-cho, Imazu-cho and Makino-cho to form Takashima City and thus dissolved along with Takashima-gun.

Kutsuki-mura had been the only village in Shiga Prefecture for a long time, but on January 1, 2005, Kutsuki-mura was merged with Takashima-cho in Takashima-gun, Adogawa-cho, Shinasahi-cho, Imazu-cho and Makino-cho to form Takashima City and thus dissolved along with Takashima-gun.

Kutsuki-mura had been the only village in Shiga Prefecture for a long time, but on January 1, 2005, Kutsuki-mura was merged with Takashima-cho (Shiga Prefecture) in Takashima-gun, Adogawa-cho, Shinasahi-cho, Imazu-cho and Makino-cho to form Takashima City and thus dissolved along with Takashima-gun.
sen.cmt: 滋賀県 を追加しました。

sen.j: 県内での地域としては湖西にあたる。
sen.e: It belonged to the Kosai area in Shiga Prefecture.
Kutsuki-mura belonged to the Kosai area in Shiga Prefecture.
Kutsuki-mura belonged to the Kosai area in Shiga Prefecture.

sen.j: 滋賀県最西端に位置し、西は京都府、北は福井県に接する。
sen.e: Kutsuki-mura was located on the eastern edge of Shiga Prefecture, and bordered Kyoto Prefecture on the west and Fukui Prefecture on the north.
Kutsuki-mura was located on the eastern edge of Shiga Prefecture, and bordered Kyoto Prefecture on the west and Fukui Prefecture on the north.
Kutsuki-mura was located on the western edge of Shiga Prefecture, and bordered Kyoto Prefecture on the west and Fukui Prefecture on the north.

sen.j: 中心地は市場。
sen.e: The main part of Kutsuki-mura was a market place.
The main part of Kutsuki-mura was a market place.
The main part of Kutsuki-mura was a market place.

sen.j: 村域東部は比良山地で、西部は丹波高地の東端部である。
sen.e: The Hira Mountains were located on the east of the village while the eastern edge of the Tanba Highlands on the west.
The Hira Mountains were located on the east of the village with the eastern edge of the Tanba Highlands located to the west.
The Hira Mountains were located on the east of the village with the eastern edge of the Tanba Highlands located to the west.

sen.j: 安曇川の上・中流域を占める。
sen.e: The middle and upper Ado-gawa River ran through the village.
The middle and upper Ado-gawa River ran through the village.
The middle and upper Ado-gawa River ran through the village.

sen.j: 古くから、旧若狭国小浜市と京都を短絡する道、俗に言う鯖街道が縦断し、街道筋として栄えた。
sen.e: The so-called Saba-kaido Road, a shortcut to connect Kyoto and Obama City in the former Wakasa Province, ran through Kutsuki-mura, and the village prospered as a place along the road.
sen.cmt: いままで、基本的には～街道は、「～ Kaido Road」としていましたが、今回から「-kaido Road」としました。
sen.e: The so-called Saba-kaido Road, a shortcut to connect Kyoto and Obama City in the former Wakasa Province, ran through Kutsuki-mura, and the village prospered as a place along the road.
The so-called Saba-kaido Road, a shortcut to connect Kyoto and Obama City in the former Wakasa Province, ran through Kutsuki-mura, and the village prospered as a place along the road.

sen.j: 現在は国道367号となっている。
sen.e: The road remains as the National Route 367.
The road remains as National Route 367.
The road remains as National Route 367.

sen.j: また、「朽木の杣」と呼ばれ、京への木材の供給地でもあった。
sen.e: Additionally, Kutsuki-mura was called 'Kutsuki no Soma' (timberland in Kutsuki), supplying wood to Kyoto.
Additionally, Kutsuki-mura was called 'Kutsuki no Soma' (timberland in Kutsuki), supplying wood to Kyoto.
Additionally, Kutsuki-mura was called 'Kutsuki no Soma' (timberland in Kutsuki), supplying wood to Kyoto.

sen.j: 1570年織田信長の朝倉攻めで浅井が裏切った時、信長は浅井の領地である湖東を避けて朽木村経由で帰郷しようとした。
sen.e: In 1570, Nobunaga ODA tried to return home by way of Kutsuki-mura instead of the Koto area ruled by Asai when he was betrayed by Asai during the attack on the Asakura clan.
In 1570, Nobunaga ODA tried to return home by way of Kutsuki-mura instead of the Koto area ruled by Asai when he was betrayed by Asai during the attack on the Asakura clan.
In 1570, Nobunaga ODA tried to return home by way of Kutsuki-mura instead of the Koto area ruled by Asai when he was betrayed by Asai during the attack on the Asakura clan.

sen.j: このとき領主であった朽木元綱（くつき もとつな）は信長を助け家臣に取り立てられた。
sen.e: Mototsuna KUTSUKI, the load of the manor in Kutsuki, helped Nobunaga and become a vassal to him.
Mototsuna KUTSUKI, the load of the manor in Kutsuki, helped Nobunaga and become a vassal to him.
Mototsuna KUTSUKI, the lord of the manor in Kutsuki, helped Nobunaga and become a vassal to him.
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。

sen.j: 朽木氏は鎌倉時代から江戸時代に掛けて朽木庄を支配していた。
sen.e: The Kutsuki clan had ruled the Kutsuki-sho (Kutsuki Manor) from the Kamakura to Edo periods.
The Kutsuki clan had ruled the Kutsuki-sho (Kutsuki Manor) from the Kamakura to Edo periods.
The Kutsuki clan had ruled the Kutsuki-sho (Kutsuki Manor) from the Kamakura to Edo periods.

sen.j: 1889年（明治22年）4月1日 町村制施行により朽木村が成立。
sen.e: On April 1, 1889, by enacting the chosonsei (Town and Village System Law), Kutsuki-mura was established.
On April 1, 1889, by enacting the chosonsei (Town and Village System Law), Kutsuki-mura was established.
April 1, 1889: By enacting the chosonsei (Town and Village System Law), Kutsuki-mura was established.
sen.cmt: "On April 1, 1889, by"→"April 1, 1889: By"に変更しました。

sen.j: 2005年（平成17年）1月1日 高島町 (滋賀県)、安曇川町、新旭町、今津町、マキノ町と合併して高島市となった
sen.e: On January 1, 2005, Kutsuki-mura, Takashima-cho, Adogawa-cho, Shinasahi-cho, Imazu-cho and Makino-cho were merged to form Takashima City.
On January 1, 2005, Kutsuki-mura, Takashima-cho, Adogawa-cho, Shinasahi-cho, Imazu-cho and Makino-cho were merged to form Takashima City.
January 1, 2005: Kutsuki-mura, Takashima-cho (Shiga Prefecture), Adogawa-cho, Shinasahi-cho, Imazu-cho and Makino-cho were merged to form Takashima City.
sen.cmt: 滋賀県 を追加しました。"On January 1, 2005,"→"January 1, 2005:"に変更しました。

sen.j: 林業が盛んで、安曇川ではかつて、木材運搬のためのいかだ流しが行われた。
sen.e: Forestry had developed in the area, and timber used to be transported via the Ado-gawa River by the method called 'ikada nagashi' (building a raft with timber and floating it down the river).
Forestry developed in the area, and timber used to be transported via the Ado-gawa River by a method called 'ikada nagashi' (building a raft with timber and floating it down the river).
Forestry developed in the area, and timber used to be transported via the Ado-gawa River by a method called 'ikada nagashi' (building a raft with timber and floating it down the river).

sen.j: 椎茸を栽培。
sen.e: Shitake Mushroom is grown.
Shitake Mushroom is grown.
Shitake Mushroom is grown.

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道湖西線安曇川駅から江若交通バスで約30分。
sen.e: Thirty-minute bus (Kojak bus) ride from Adogawa Station on the Kosai Line (West Japan Railway Company)
Thirty-minute bus (Kojak bus) ride from Adogawa Station on the Kosai Line (West Japan Railway Company)
Thirty-minute bus (Kojak bus) ride from Adogawa Station on the Kosai Line (West Japan Railway Company)

sen.j: 国道367号
sen.e: National Route 367
National Route 367
National Route 367

sen.j: 毎週日曜日午前7時より、道の駅道の駅くつき新本陣で「日曜朝市」が行われる。
sen.e: The Sunday Morning Market is held at seven in the morning every Sunday in the Kutsuki Shinhonjin, a Michi-no-Eki, or Roadside Station (a roadside rest area where one can take a rest, purchase local food and products, and get local information).
sen.cmt: 原文には 「道の駅道の駅」 とありますが、リンク先の単語が抽出されるバグのようですので、重複して訳出しておりません。
sen.e: The Sunday Morning Market is held at seven in the morning every Sunday in the Kutsuki Shinhonjin, a Michi-no-Eki, or Roadside Station (a roadside rest area where one can take a rest, purchase local food and products, and get local information).
